Description: A trapdoor is a hidden piece of code that responds to a special input, allowing its user access to resources without passing through the normal security enforcement mechanism.

Detection_Method.Method: Automated Static Analysis - Binary or Bytecode

Description.xhtml:p: According to SOAR, the following detection techniques may be useful:

xhtml:li: Binary / Bytecode simple extractor - strings, ELF readers, etc.

Detection_Method.Method: Manual Static Analysis - Binary or Bytecode

Description.xhtml:p: According to SOAR, the following detection techniques may be useful:

xhtml:li: Binary / Bytecode disassembler - then use manual analysis for vulnerabilities & anomalies

Detection_Method.Method: Dynamic Analysis with Manual Results Interpretation

Description.xhtml:p: According to SOAR, the following detection techniques may be useful:

xhtml:li: Monitored Virtual Environment - run potentially malicious code in sandbox / wrapper / virtual machine, see if it does anything suspicious

Description.xhtml:p: According to SOAR, the following detection techniques may be useful:

xhtml:ul.xhtml:li: Focused Manual Spotcheck - Focused manual analysis of source

Description.xhtml:p: According to SOAR, the following detection techniques may be useful:
According to SOAR, the following detection techniques may be useful:

xhtml:ul.xhtml:li: Inspection (IEEE 1028 standard) (can apply to requirements, design, source code, etc.)

Mitigation.Description: Always verify the integrity of the software that is being installed.
Identify and closely inspect the conditions for entering privileged areas of the code, especially those related to authentication, process invocation, and network communications.
